items.title: What we know about new Epstein emails that mention Trump
items.standfirst: In emails released by Democrats, Epstein says Trump "knew about the girls". The White House says they are an attempt to "smear" the president.
items.content: In emails released by Democrats, Epstein says Trump "knew about the girls". The White House says they are an attempt to "smear" the president.

items.title: Rep. Grijalva: I will sign petition to release Epstein files 'right now'

items.content: After being sworn in to Congress, Arizona Democrat Adelita Grijalva says she will sign petition to release Epstein files "right now.

items.title: Details on newly released Epstein emails that mention Trump
items.standfirst: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee have released email exchanges between convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and others about President Trump. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang reports.
items.content: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee have released email exchanges between convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and others about President Trump. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang reports.

items.title: US lawmakers release Epstein emails referencing Trump
items.standfirst: US lawmakers on Wednesday released a trove of emails from Jeffrey Epstein that reference Donald Trump, heightening scrutiny over the president’s ties to the disgraced financier and sex offender. Some of the communications suggest Trump was more aware of Epstein’s conduct than he has acknowledged;…
items.content: US lawmakers on Wednesday released a trove of emails from Jeffrey Epstein that reference Donald Trump, heightening scrutiny over the president’s ties to the disgraced financier and sex offender. Some of the communications suggest Trump was more aware of Epstein’s conduct than he has acknowledged;…

items.title: Arizona’s Adelita Grijalva sworn in after seven weeks in move that could force Epstein vote
items.standfirst: Mike Johnson, the House speaker, had prevented the representative from taking her seat after a special electionArizona Democrat Adelita Grijalva was sworn in by Mike Johnson, the US House speaker, on Wednesday, ending a contentious seven-week standoff that prevented the incoming congresswoman from taking her seat and clearing the path for a vote to release the Jeffrey Epstein files.House Democrats burst into applause on the House floor when Grijalva took the oath of office during a ceremonial swearing in, shortly before the chamber was poised to take up legislation that would end the longest federal government shutdown in US history. The ceremony comes seven weeks after Grijalva won a late September special election to succeed her father, the longtime congressman Raúl Grijalva, who died in March. Continue reading...
items.content: Mike Johnson, the House speaker, had prevented the representative from taking her seat after a special electionArizona Democrat Adelita Grijalva was sworn in by Mike Johnson, the US House speaker, on Wednesday, ending a contentious seven-week standoff that prevented the incoming congresswoman from taking her seat and clearing the path for a vote to release the Jeffrey Epstein files.House Democrats burst into applause on the House floor when Grijalva took the oath of office during a ceremonial swearing in, shortly before the chamber was poised to take up legislation that would end the longest federal government shutdown in US history. The ceremony comes seven weeks after Grijalva won a late September special election to succeed her father, the longtime congressman Raúl Grijalva, who died in March. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Democrats returned to pressing Donald Trump on his ties to Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting a selection of emails in which the late financier and convicted sex trafficker suggested the president knew of his activities. A congressional committee on Wednesday released some 20,000 pages of documents,…
items.content: Democrats returned to pressing Donald Trump on his ties to Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting a selection of emails in which the late financier and convicted sex trafficker suggested the president knew of his activities. items.content: Grijalva was sworn in as the newest member of Congress on Wednesday, more than seven weeks after she won a special election in Arizona to fill the House seat last held by her late father.

items.content: The Trump administration has been criticized for failing to release files about convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, a former friend of President Trump.

items.title: Watch: Adelita Grijalva sworn into Congress 7 weeks after winning House election
items.standfirst: House Speaker Mike Johnson swore in Adelita Grijalva as a member of Congress on Wednesday, seven weeks after the Democrat won her election in Arizona. Johnson kept the House in recess as the Senate worked to end the government shutdown.
items.content: House Speaker Mike Johnson swore in Adelita Grijalva as a member of Congress on Wednesday, seven weeks after the Democrat won her election in Arizona. Johnson kept the House in recess as the Senate worked to end the government shutdown.

items.title: Adelita Grijalva is finally sworn in as Trump scrambles to derail Epstein files measure
items.standfirst: As Adelita Grijalva is sworn in, Donald Trump is scrambling to kill the Epstein files discharge petition the Arizona Democrat is poised to sign.
items.content: As Adelita Grijalva is sworn in, Donald Trump is scrambling to kill the Epstein files discharge petition the Arizona Democrat is poised to sign.

items.title: Adelita Grijalva is sworn in to House, pledges to force Epstein disclosure
items.standfirst: Arizona Democrat Adelita Grijalva was sworn in to the House Wednesday after a record 50-day wait, vowing to immediately join an effort to disclose files related to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Grijalva had expressed no special interest in the Epstein case prior to her Sept. 23 election.…

Grijalva had expressed no special interest in the Epstein case prior to her Sept. 23 election.…

items.content: Democrats say new correspondence ‘raises glaring questions’ about president’s ties with late paedophile

items.title: White House calls Epstein emails release a Democratic smear
items.standfirst: Jeffrey Epstein wrote in a 2019 email to a journalist that Donald Trump “knew about the girls," according to documents made public Wednesday, but what he knew — and whether it pertained to the sex offender’s crimes — is unclear. The White House quickly accused Democrats of selectively leaking the emails to smear the president. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis has more.
items.content: Jeffrey Epstein wrote in a 2019 email to a journalist that Donald Trump “knew about the girls," according to documents made public Wednesday, but what he knew — and whether it pertained to the sex offender’s crimes — is unclear. The White House quickly accused Democrats of selectively leaking the emails to smear the president. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis has more.

items.title: White House: Epstein emails ‘prove nothing’
items.standfirst: The White House says emails from sex offender Jeffrey Epstein about President Trump “prove absolutely nothing."
items.content: The White House says emails from sex offender Jeffrey Epstein about President Trump “prove absolutely nothing."

items.title: House Democrats release Epstein papers saying Trump 'knew about the girls'
items.standfirst: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein said Donald Trump knew about the girls that Epstein was accused of victimizing, according to emails released on Wednesday by U.S. House of Representatives Democrats, which the White House blasted as a "fake narrative." FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson reports from Washington.
items.content: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein said Donald Trump knew about the girls that Epstein was accused of victimizing, according to emails released on Wednesday by U.S. House of Representatives Democrats, which the White House blasted as a "fake narrative." FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson reports from Washington.

items.title: Trump ‘spent hours’ with victim at Epstein’s house, emails allege
items.standfirst: US president calls emails a 'hoax' meant to distract from government shutdown crisis, without addressing their content.
items.content: US president calls emails a 'hoax' meant to distract from government shutdown crisis, without addressing their content.

ai_summary: US lawmakers released emails from Jeffrey Epstein referencing Donald Trump on Wednesday.
Some communications suggest Trump was more aware of Epstein's conduct than acknowledged.
Arizona's Adelita Grijalva was sworn in, ending a seven-week standoff.
The swearing in cleared the path for a vote to release the Jeffrey Epstein files.
House Democrats applauded Grijalva's swearing in on the House floor.

clusters.title: Ukraine ministers resign over major corruption scandals
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine Ministers Resign Over Major Corruption Scandals

items.title: Ukraine ministers resign over major corruption scandals
items.standfirst: Cracking down on graft is seen as a key requirement of Kyiv's bid to join the European Union
items.content: Cracking down on graft is seen as a key requirement of Kyiv's bid to join the European Union

items.title: Ukraine justice, energy ministers resign over major corruption scandal
items.standfirst: Ukraine's energy and justice ministers resigned on Wednesday, the government said, over their alleged involvement in a sweeping corruption scandal in the country's energy sector. Investigators alleged a key ally of President Volodymyr Zelensky orchestrated a $100-million kickback scheme to siphon off funds, triggering public anger at a time of widespread power outages caused by Russian attacks.
items.content: Ukraine's energy and justice ministers resigned on Wednesday, the government said, over their alleged involvement in a sweeping corruption scandal in the country's energy sector. Investigators alleged a key ally of President Volodymyr Zelensky orchestrated a $100-million kickback scheme to siphon off funds, triggering public anger at a time of widespread power outages caused by Russian attacks.

items.title: Ukraine ministers toppled amid embezzlement and kickbacks scandal
items.standfirst: Ukraine's justice and energy ministers have resigned amid a major embezzlement and kickbacks scandal involving the state nuclear power company.
items.content: Ukraine's justice and energy ministers have resigned amid a major embezzlement and kickbacks scandal involving the state nuclear power company.

items.title: ‘Absolutely unacceptable’: Zelenskyy condemns corruption in energy sector targeted by Russia
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he had suspended the justice and energy ministers, pending an investigation into a $100 million kickback scandal centered on the country’s embattled energy sector.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he had suspended the justice and energy ministers, pending an investigation into a $100 million kickback scandal centered on the country’s embattled energy sector.

items.title: Major corruption scandal engulfs top Zelensky allies
items.standfirst: The Ukrainian president has called for the justice and energy ministers to be removed from their posts.
items.content: The Ukrainian president has called for the justice and energy ministers to be removed from their posts.

items.title: $100M corruption scandal rocks Ukraine and embroils top Zelenskyy ally
items.standfirst: Ukraine Justice Minister German Galushchenko was suspended in a corruption probe into state energy company Energoatom that includes Zelenskyy ally Timur Mindich.
items.content: Ukraine Justice Minister German Galushchenko was suspended in a corruption probe into state energy company Energoatom that includes Zelenskyy ally Timur Mindich.

ai_summary: Ukraine's justice and energy ministers resigned on Wednesday due to corruption allegations.
The resignations followed a $100 million kickback scheme in the energy sector.
President Zelenskyy suspended the ministers pending an investigation.
The scandal involves a key ally of President Zelenskyy, Timur Mindich.
Cracking down on graft is a key requirement for Ukraine's EU bid.

items.standfirst: President Herzog's office says he holds Trump "in the highest regard", but that anyone seeking a pardon has to submit a formal request.

items.title: Israeli president says he can't pardon Netanyahu on Trump's request alone

items.content: Israel's president says Trump sent him a letter asking him to pardon Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who's on trial in three separate corruption cases.

items.title: Trump sends letter to Israel’s president requesting pardon for Netanyahu
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump sent a letter to Israel's president requesting he pardon Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
items.content: US President Donald Trump sent a letter to Israel's president requesting he pardon Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

items.title: Trump formally asks Israel’s president to pardon Netanyahu after Gaza truce

items.content: US president calls corruption charges against Israeli PM 'unjustified', describing Netanyahu as 'formidable' leader.

items.title: Trump writes to Israeli president calling for Netanyahu pardon
items.standfirst: Isaac Herzog can pardon convicted criminals in some circumstances, but cases against Israeli PM are ongoingDonald Trump has repeated a request to Israel’s president, Isaac Herzog, for a pardon for Benjamin Netanyahu, who is on trial in three separate corruption cases.The Israeli prime minister has repeatedly denied any wrongdoing in the ongoing court cases. No rulings have been delivered, and his supporters have dismissed the trials as politically motivated. Continue reading...
items.content: Isaac Herzog can pardon convicted criminals in some circumstances, but cases against Israeli PM are ongoingDonald Trump has repeated a request to Israel’s president, Isaac Herzog, for a pardon for Benjamin Netanyahu, who is on trial in three separate corruption cases.The Israeli prime minister has repeatedly denied any wrongdoing in the ongoing court cases. No rulings have been delivered, and his supporters have dismissed the trials as politically motivated. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Donald Trump has sent a letter to the Israeli president urging him to "fully pardon" Benjamin Netanyahu in his long-running corruption trial.
items.content: Donald Trump has sent a letter to the Israeli president urging him to "fully pardon" Benjamin Netanyahu in his long-running corruption trial.

ai_summary: Donald Trump sent a letter to Israel's president requesting a pardon for Netanyahu.
Trump described corruption charges against Netanyahu as "unjustified".
Israel's president said he cannot pardon Netanyahu based on Trump's request alone.
Netanyahu is on trial in three separate corruption cases.
The Israeli prime minister denies any wrongdoing in the ongoing court cases.

clusters.title: French relief as Algeria frees jailed novelist at centre of diplomatic crisis
clusters.neutral_headline: French Relief as Algeria Frees Jailed Novelist

items.title: French relief as Algeria frees jailed novelist at centre of diplomatic crisis
items.standfirst: Almost a year to the day after Boualem Sansal was arrested, the Algerian president grants him a pardon.
items.content: Almost a year to the day after Boualem Sansal was arrested, the Algerian president grants him a pardon.

items.title: Pardoned French-Algerian dissident writer Sansal en route to Germany
items.standfirst: Algerian President Abdelmadjid Tebboune has granted a pardon to French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal following a request from German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier, the Algerian presidency said on Wednesday. Algerian authorities arrested Sansal a year ago and a court sentenced him in March to five years in jail for 'undermining national unity'.
items.content: Algerian President Abdelmadjid Tebboune has granted a pardon to French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal following a request from German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier, the Algerian presidency said on Wednesday. Algerian authorities arrested Sansal a year ago and a court sentenced him in March to five years in jail for 'undermining national unity'.

items.title: French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal pardoned and to be released from prison
items.standfirst: Eighty-one year-old, who has prostate cancer, can now be transferred from Algeria to Germany for medical treatmentThe French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal has been pardoned and is to be released from prison, the Algerian presidential office said in a statement on Wednesday.The move, which will mean Sansal can be transferred to Germany for medical treatment, comes after the German president, Frank-Walter Steinmeier, urged Algeria to free Sansal. Continue reading...
items.content: Eighty-one year-old, who has prostate cancer, can now be transferred from Algeria to Germany for medical treatmentThe French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal has been pardoned and is to be released from prison, the Algerian presidential office said in a statement on Wednesday.The move, which will mean Sansal can be transferred to Germany for medical treatment, comes after the German president, Frank-Walter Steinmeier, urged Algeria to free Sansal. Continue reading...

items.title: Algeria pardons French-Algerian author Sansal after year-long imprisonment
items.standfirst: Algeria ’s president granted a humanitarian pardon to the French-Algerian novelist Boualem Sansal on Wednesday, releasing him after a year-long imprisonment that sparked widespread criticism.
items.content: Algeria ’s president granted a humanitarian pardon to the French-Algerian novelist Boualem Sansal on Wednesday, releasing him after a year-long imprisonment that sparked widespread criticism.

items.title: Algeria’s president pardons jailed writer Boualem Sansal
items.standfirst: The pardon of the 81-year-old author comes after Germany appealed for his release on 'humanitarian grounds'.
items.content: The pardon of the 81-year-old author comes after Germany appealed for his release on 'humanitarian grounds'.

ai_summary: Algeria pardoned French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal after a year of imprisonment.
The pardon came after a request from German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier.
Sansal was sentenced to five years in jail for "undermining national unity".
Sansal can now be transferred to Germany for medical treatment.
The move sparked widespread criticism and calls for his release.

clusters.title: India calls Delhi blast a ‘terror’ attack by ‘anti-national forces’
clusters.neutral_headline: India Confirms Delhi Blast Being Treated as Terror Incident

items.title: India calls Delhi blast a ‘terror’ attack by ‘anti-national forces’
items.standfirst: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's cabinet on Wednesday called this week's car explosion near New Delhi's historic Red Fort a "heinous terror incident" conducted by "anti-national forces". While authorities did not release any evidence linked to the blast, the classification gives investigators sweeping powers to arrest people and prolong detentions.
items.content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's cabinet on Wednesday called this week's car explosion near New Delhi's historic Red Fort a "heinous terror incident" conducted by "anti-national forces". While authorities did not release any evidence linked to the blast, the classification gives investigators sweeping powers to arrest people and prolong detentions.

items.title: India confirms deadly Delhi car blast being treated as terror incident
items.standfirst: Cabinet says explosion near Red Fort that killed 12 is suspected to have been perpetrated by ‘anti-national forces’India has confirmed it is treating the explosion that killed 12 people outside Delhi’s Red Fort on Monday as a “terror incident” perpetrated by “anti-national forces”.The statement by the cabinet, led by the prime minister, Narendra Modi, confirmed mounting speculation that a terrorist attack was behind the blast that took place during peak time in one of the capital’s busiest areas and outside one of India’s major landmarks. Continue reading...
items.content: Cabinet says explosion near Red Fort that killed 12 is suspected to have been perpetrated by ‘anti-national forces’India has confirmed it is treating the explosion that killed 12 people outside Delhi’s Red Fort on Monday as a “terror incident” perpetrated by “anti-national forces”.The statement by the cabinet, led by the prime minister, Narendra Modi, confirmed mounting speculation that a terrorist attack was behind the blast that took place during peak time in one of the capital’s busiest areas and outside one of India’s major landmarks. Continue reading...

items.title: Pakistan opens investigation into Islamabad terror attack
items.standfirst: Pakistani ministers attribute deadly suicide attack to Indian state terrorism but India denies claimPakistan has opened an investigation into the suicide attack that killed 12 people outside district court buildings in Islamabad, after the prime minister made unsubstantiated claims that “Indian state terrorism” was behind the blast.The attack took place in the middle of the day on Tuesday as the area was thrumming with people. The bomber made several attempts to get inside the buildings before detonating a device next to a police car, killing 12 people and injuring 27. Continue reading...
items.content: Pakistani ministers attribute deadly suicide attack to Indian state terrorism but India denies claimPakistan has opened an investigation into the suicide attack that killed 12 people outside district court buildings in Islamabad, after the prime minister made unsubstantiated claims that “Indian state terrorism” was behind the blast.The attack took place in the middle of the day on Tuesday as the area was thrumming with people. The bomber made several attempts to get inside the buildings before detonating a device next to a police car, killing 12 people and injuring 27. Continue reading...

items.title: Indian police investigating fatal Delhi car blast under anti-terror law
items.standfirst: Statements from government ministers suggest they do not see explosion that killed eight people as an accidentIndian police are investigating a car explosion that killed eight people outside Delhi’s historic Red Fort under an anti-terror law, as they focus on the final movements of the vehicle involved.The explosion on Monday occurred at about 7pm, a peak time when Delhi’s old city is usually packed with people and traffic. Continue reading...
items.content: Statements from government ministers suggest they do not see explosion that killed eight people as an accidentIndian police are investigating a car explosion that killed eight people outside Delhi’s historic Red Fort under an anti-terror law, as they focus on the final movements of the vehicle involved.The explosion on Monday occurred at about 7pm, a peak time when Delhi’s old city is usually packed with people and traffic. Continue reading...

items.title: Pakistan Taliban claim responsibility for deadly terror attack in Islamabad
items.standfirst: Defence minister says country is in ‘state of war’ after suicide blast kills 12 and injures 27 outside court buildingsAt least 12 people have been killed in a suicide blast in Islamabad carried out by the Pakistan Taliban, as the country’s defence minister said a deadly surge in terror attacks had put the country in a “state of war”.The explosion, which was confirmed as a suicide attack by several government ministers, took place outside district court buildings in the capital on Tuesday at about 12.30pm. The area is usually heavily crowded with lawyers and litigants attending trials. Continue reading...
items.content: Defence minister says country is in ‘state of war’ after suicide blast kills 12 and injures 27 outside court buildingsAt least 12 people have been killed in a suicide blast in Islamabad carried out by the Pakistan Taliban, as the country’s defence minister said a deadly surge in terror attacks had put the country in a “state of war”.The explosion, which was confirmed as a suicide attack by several government ministers, took place outside district court buildings in the capital on Tuesday at about 12.30pm. The area is usually heavily crowded with lawyers and litigants attending trials. Continue reading...

items.title: At least 12 killed after suicide bombing in Pakistan
items.standfirst: At least 12 people have been killed in a suicide bombing outside the gates of a court in Pakistan's capital of Islamabad, the country's interior minister has said.
items.content: At least 12 people have been killed in a suicide bombing outside the gates of a court in Pakistan's capital of Islamabad, the country's interior minister has said.

ai_summary: India is treating the Delhi car explosion as a "terror incident".
The cabinet called the explosion a "heinous terror incident" by "anti-national forces".
Pakistan opened an investigation into the Islamabad terror attack.
The Delhi explosion killed eight people.
Indian police are investigating the Delhi explosion under anti-terror law.

clusters.title: Israeli president condemns ‘serious’ attack by settlers on West Bank villages
clusters.neutral_headline: Israeli President Condemns Attack by Settlers

items.title: Israeli president condemns ‘serious’ attack by settlers on West Bank villages
items.standfirst: Isaac Herzog makes rare statement on often-ignored violence as settlers injure Palestinians and attack soldiersDozens of masked Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian villages in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday, injuring four Palestinians and attacking Israeli soldiers in the latest incident of rising settler violence.The settlers attacked the Palestinian villages of Beit Lid and Deir Sharaf, setting vehicles on fire and damaging property belonging to a Bedouin community, with charred remains of cars left behind the next day. Continue reading...
items.content: Isaac Herzog makes rare statement on often-ignored violence as settlers injure Palestinians and attack soldiersDozens of masked Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian villages in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday, injuring four Palestinians and attacking Israeli soldiers in the latest incident of rising settler violence.The settlers attacked the Palestinian villages of Beit Lid and Deir Sharaf, setting vehicles on fire and damaging property belonging to a Bedouin community, with charred remains of cars left behind the next day. Continue reading...

items.title: Masked Israeli settlers attack Palestinian villages and IDF soldiers in the West Bank
items.standfirst: Settlers attacked Palestinians and set fire to property in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday before clashing with soldiers sent to break up their rampage.
items.content: Settlers attacked Palestinians and set fire to property in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday before clashing with soldiers sent to break up their rampage.

items.title: Israeli settlers set fire to Palestinian warehouse and land as West Bank attacks surge
items.standfirst: Several Palestinians were also injured when settlers launched arson attacks targeting an industrial area, a Bedouin village, and farmland east of Tulkarm.
items.content: Several Palestinians were also injured when settlers launched arson attacks targeting an industrial area, a Bedouin village, and farmland east of Tulkarm.

ai_summary: Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian villages in the occupied West Bank.
Settlers injured Palestinians and attacked Israeli soldiers.

items.standfirst: Dana Williamson among five co-conspirators in scheme to steal more than $225,000 from Xavier Becerra’s campaignA former top aide to California governor Gavin Newsom has been indicted on federal charges alleging her involvement in a scheme to steal campaign money from Xavier Becerra, the former US health secretary.Dana Williamson was arrested and scheduled to make her first court appearance Wednesday in Sacramento.
